resources.string: This notification confirms that the order is placed
You have not placed any orders

A.1 It\'s really simple â€“ please make sure you are logged in and fill out the form below. You will immediately be granted access to SpoonBack and you can start right away. We look forward to reading all about your foodie adventures!

A.2 A Spoonback is an automatic link from a Nomato restaurant page to your blog post. You review the restaurant on your blog, and we\'ll link to your post. The link appears in a special Blogs section on each Nomato restaurant page, city feed, your Food Journey, your profile page, and your followers\' feeds.

A.4 Here at Nomato, we prominently display blogger reviews. If you use Spoonbacks, Nomato users will see an excerpt from your review, and a link to click through to your blog. In short, you get exposure and traffic to your blog for free.

A.3 Once you add a spoonback to your blog post, it will reflect on your Nomato profile page under \'Pending Posts\' within 24 hours. From here you can easily add a rating, photos, tag friends and publish your blog post on Nomato. If it has been significantly longer than that, please write to us at bloggerhelp@nomato.com and we\'ll investigate. It\'s helpful if you can provide us with links to the blog posts in question.

A.5 Top Blogger rankings are based on the number of blog posts (excerpts) that the blogger has published on Nomato via Spoonbacks. Note that only one blog post per restaurant is counted towards the Top Bloggers rankings.

A.6 We request you to claim access to food related blogs only. Our team runs a verification on all registered blogs and blogs which are irrelevant to the Nomato platform i.e.non-food related, or containing objectionable content, these are revoked.

string.name: register_yourself

resources.string: Enter your registered mobile number and email :
Your order has been successfully placed :)
